Definition: In this task, you are given a conversation, and your task is to generate a summary from the information present in the given conversation. Generate a summary in such a way that the context should be present in the conversation. It must cover the complete context of the conversation.
Domains: Commonsense -> Concepts and Relations -> Social Commonsense

Positive Examples.input: Rob: So how's the cat?, June: fine I guess, June: file_photo>, Mark: the vet said she's gonna have to wear that for 10 days, Rob: 10 days? yikes? what ca I do to help?, June: I don't think there's anything, Jack: well thanks man! was really nice meeting your brother last night!, June: yeah, bye
Liam: We really need Jimmy Johnston on the show! Can you reserve a spot? I can book a few tickets for you, but we need to know as soon as possible. Thanks!!
Dorothy: mom's birthday party yesterday!, Ellie: I know what you want me to make... food?, Dorothy: potato soup with blue cheese, Linda: so good!! thank you for thinking about my needs 3

Instances.input: Liam: We really need some new material for the website!, Jamie: Agreed., Jude: yeah, well..., Jude: Leon?, Leon: i know i've been working on it recently, but havent had time to finish it, Liam: give me 5 mins, Damian: Oh cool I can get them done then, tomorrow, Claire: no problem at all
